node.title: Sad end for sperm whale in Tasmania a boon for science
node.alt: Sperm whale stranded on a beach.
node.description: Efforts to save a whale stranded off the north coast of Tasmania fail â€” however the demise of the animal may benefit scientists.
node.content:
["Efforts to save a whale stranded off the north coast of Tasmania have failed \u2014 however the demise of the animal may at least benefit scientists.", "The male sperm whale became stranded on Sunday near the North East River, with efforts to get the animal back into deeper water continuing on Monday.", "Tasmania's Department of Primary Industries, Parks, Water and Environment (DPIPWE) said refloating the 12-tonne whale was not an option.\u00a0", "Marine conservation staff provided the whale with sedation and\u00a0it died from natural causes overnight.\u00a0", "For scientists, the death of the whale provides a rare insight into an elusive species about which many questions still remain.\u00a0", "", "
A southern right whale and its calf swim in shallow waters\u00a0off Tasmania's east coast in 2009.(Department of Primary Industries, Parks, Water and Environment)
", "DPIPWE wildlife biologist Kris Carlyon said staff have started taking samples from the whale as part of post-mortem investigations, which will be flown off the island with the crew.\u00a0", "\"That includes taking a whole lot of samples that can be archived away and allow researchers to add them into their ongoing work.\"", "", "
Rescuers managed to save a number of whales in the mass stranding of 2020 on Tasmania's west coast.(ABC News: Edith Bevin)
", "It was the second sperm whale to become stranded on a Tasmanian beach in three weeks, after a whale died on Bruny Island in the state's south.\u00a0", "
What are scientists looking for?\u00a0
", "Sperm whales are deep-sea animals, so researching them is often done from afar.\u00a0", "Dr Carlyon said a range of tests could be done on the whale.\u00a0", "\"We might be looking for any pollutants,\u00a0is there anything toxic that animal has been exposed to, we look in the stomach,\u00a0we are very keen to see what the animal has been feeding on,\" he said.\u00a0", "", "
This killer whale became stranded on Badger Beach in 2019.(Supplied: DPIPWE)
", "Analysing the whale could also help scientists understand why the whale became stranded in the first place.\u00a0", "\"It might give us a hint as to whether we should expect more strandings in the future,\" Dr\u00a0Carlyon said.\u00a0", "", "
Dr Vanessa Pirotta.(Supplied:\u00a0Dr Vanessa Pirotta)
", "Dr Vanessa Pirotta,\u00a0a marine scientist at Macquarie University,\u00a0said the whale's death is a unique opportunity for science.\u00a0", "\"This will provide a huge amount of knowledge, contributing to our knowledge gap of sperm whales around the world,\" she said.", "\"The best thing that can come out of a whale stranding is the opportunity to learn more about these amazing creatures.\u00a0", "\"We often use boats or drones \u2014\u00a0this is direct access to learn from this whale internally.", "
Examining the whale\u00a0
", "A team of wildlife biologists and vets are completing a necropsy of the whale, taking skin and blood samples.", "", "
A mass stranding of whales in shallow water at Macquarie Heads\u00a0in September 2020, as seen from above.(ABC News: Cameron Atkins)
", "Kris Carlyon said it was \"quite a challenging job\".", "\"We've got long-bladed knives that we use to access the internal parts of the animal.\"", "\"This animal is extremely large. It's not like a vet operating on a cat or a dog. This is next level.\"", "\"The samples will be flown with the team back to Hobart. We're not talking whale-sized samples, we're talking about an esky full of samples.\"", "Dr Pirotta said scientists would be interested in accessing various parts of the whale for research.\u00a0", "\"Accessing areas like their stomach is not an easy or simple cut, and you need a huge amount of tools and knowledge as to where to locate the stomach and how to access that,\" she said.\u00a0", "", "
The carcass of a Bryde's whale lies rotting on a beach in southern Tasmania.(Tasmanian Museum and Art Gallery)
", "
Disposing of the carcass\u00a0
", "In 1970, a dead sperm whale in America was blown to smithereens in an attempt to remove the rotting carcass.\u00a0", "That technique backfired, as whale chunks landed on cars and people.\u00a0", "Dr Pirotta said thankfully, that does not occur these days.\u00a0", "\"We have better protocols in place now so we can access the valuable data and appropriately dispose of an animal,\" she said.\u00a0", "DPIPWE said due to the size and weight of the animal, removing it from the beach was not a viable option, with the public urged to stay away from the water as the carcass could attract sharks.\u00a0", "Authorities ask that if members of the public see a stranded whale or dolphin (alive or dead), they report it to the Marine Conservation Program on 0427 WHALES (0427 942537)."]
